\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 39379}

\subsection*{Military Drug Test}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{ChemDream}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 &   &  & Amphetamines & \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 0.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I was discharged from the navy for testing positive for amphetamines. 



All branches take the same action as they have a zero tolerance policy and a administrative discharge of other-than-honorable will be awarded. You can fight it by request of court martial but losing means your discharge will turned to a bad conduct discharge just below dishonorable which will stain your record like a felony could. Before your test you can list known false positve drugs and supplemnts that you've taken if you know your gonna fail and fight it that way.



I have heard of some rare cases where a general under honorable discharge was given.



Good luck though.

\end{document}
